Differential Extinction and the Contrasting Structure of Polar Marine Faunas
Article
Full-text available
  • Dec 2010
  • Andrew Z Krug
  • David Jablonski
  • Kaustuv Roy

Create new project "It's Our Time"

  • 1 Update
Integrating fossils and genetics of living molluscs
Project
We are studying the evolution of extant species that are represented in the New Zealand fossil record. By combining molecular phylogenetics with geometric morphometrics we can determine species boundaries and evolutionary relationships. Well integrated paleontological data and extant organisms of New Zealand monophyletic lineages allows us to model morphological evolution and test the predictions of punctuated equilibrium.
